Public NotInheritable Class WebServiceInputActivity Inherits Activity Implements IActivityEventListener(Of QueueEventArgs), IDynamicPropertyTypeProvider, IEventActivity
type WebServiceInputActivity = class inherit Activity interface IEventActivity interface IActivityEventListener<QueueEventArgs> interface IDynamicPropertyTypeProvider

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The System.Workflow.* types are deprecated. Instead, please use the new types from System.Activities.*")

Docs.summary: Enables receiving data from a Web service in a workflow. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > [!INCLUDE[DeprecatedContent](~/includes/deprecatedcontent-md.md)]
The <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.WebServiceInputActivity> corresponds to a Web service method when the containing workflow is deployed as a Web service. When the workflow Web service is called, the <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.WebServiceInputActivity> receives data.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool IsActivating { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.IsActivating : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether receiving data should start the workflow.
Docs.value: if receiving data should start the workflow; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks Only the first receive in a workflow can have the <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.WebServiceInputActivity.IsActivating%2A> property set to `true`. If more than one <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.WebServiceInputActivity.IsActivating%2A> is set to `true`, the session is locked on the first request. This lasts as long as the other receive blocks the workflow; the session is deadlocked.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly IsActivatingProperty As DependencyProperty

Docs.summary: Represents the that targets the property.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.WebServiceInputActivity.IsActivating%2A> property should be set to `true` for only the very first <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.WebServiceInputActivity>. This signals to the workflow runtime that invoking this Web service method from a client starts the execution of the workflow. The first activity of a workflow definition that is exposed as a Web service is of type <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.WebServiceInputActivity> and sets this property to `true`. [!INCLUDE[DependencyPropertyRemark](~/includes/dependencypropertyremark-md.md)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property ParameterBindings As WorkflowParameterBindingCollection

Docs.summary: Gets the collection of bindings associated with the input parameters to the method specified in the property.
Docs.value: The collection of properties used as inbound parameters on the method specified by the property.

remarks.format: ## Remarks <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.WebServiceInputActivity.ParameterBindings%2A> on a <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.WebServiceInputActivity> are used to bind the inbound parameters to locations in the workflow. When the <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.WebServiceInputActivity> executes, the bound locations are set to the values of the corresponding inbound parameters.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Workflow::Activities::WorkflowRoleCollection ^ Roles { System::Workflow::Activities::WorkflowRoleCollection ^ get(); void set(System::Workflow::Activities::WorkflowRoleCollection ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a collection of roles that are valid to send data to the .
Docs.value: The that contains the Web service roles that are valid to send data to the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Security access exceptions are thrown if the Web service receives a request from a non-member of the <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.WebServiceInputActivity.Roles%2A> collection.
The default value is an empty collection, which gives open access to the Web service.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly RolesProperty As DependencyProperty

Docs.summary: Identifies the valid user roles that are allowed to send messages from the Web service client to the . The two types of supported roles are Active Directory and ASP.NET.
